messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

[
  {
    "path": "/dashboard",
    "handler": "App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\ShowDashboard",
    "implementation_present_in_file": false,
    "is_prefix": false,
    "is_literal": true,
    "is_derived_from_naming_convention": false,
    "is_restful": false,
    "is_testing": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/posts",
    "handler": "App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\PostController",
    "implementation_present_in_file": false,
    "is_prefix": true,
    "is_literal": true,
    "is_derived_from_naming_convention": true,
    "is_restful": true,
    "is_testing": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/posts/{post}/thumbnail",
    "handler": "App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\PostThumbnailController::destroy",
    "implementation_present_in_file": false,
    "is_prefix": false,
    "is_literal": true,
    "is_derived_from_naming_convention": false,
    "is_restful": true,
    "is_testing": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/users",
    "handler": "App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\UserController",
    "implementation_present_in_file": false,
    "is_prefix": true,
    "is_literal": true,
    "is_derived_from_naming_convention": true,
    "is_restful": true,
    "is_testing": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/comments",
    "handler": "App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\CommentController",
    "implementation_present_in_file": false,
    "is_prefix": true,
    "is_literal": true,
    "is_derived_from_naming_convention": true,
    "is_restful": true,
    "is_testing": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/media",
    "handler": "App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\MediaLibraryController",
    "implementation_present_in_file": false,
    "is_prefix": true,
    "is_literal": true,
    "is_derived_from_naming_convention": true,
    "is_restful": true,
    "is_testing": false
  }
]

Explanation:

- I extracted every explicit Route::... entry from routes/admin.php.
  - Route::get('dashboard', ShowDashboard::class) becomes the GET path /dashboard handled by App\Http\Controllers\Admin\ShowDashboard.
  - Route::delete('/posts/{post}/thumbnail', [PostThumbnailController::class, 'destroy']) is an explicit DELETE route for /posts/{post}/thumbnail and maps to the destroy method on App\Http\Controllers\Admin\PostThumbnailController.
  - Each Route::resource(...) call was recorded as a single API entry using the literal path prefix provided (e.g., 'posts', 'users', 'comments', 'media') and the controller class. Resource routes are generated by Laravel from that prefix and the controller by a naming convention (index, show, create, store, edit, update, destroy). Because the file contains the literal prefix strings, I set is_literal = true and also set is_derived_from_naming_convention = true for those entries to indicate the framework expands them into multiple RESTful endpoints. For the resource routes I also set is_prefix = true because the resource string acts as a path prefix rather than a single full path present in this file.

- For each entry:
  - implementation_present_in_file is false because the handlers are controller classes imported via use statements; their implementations are not in routes/admin.php.
  - is_testing is false for all entries because none are test-only routes.
  - is_restful is true for resource entries (and the DELETE thumbnail route, which operates on a resource), and false for the dashboard GET (a non-RESTful dashboard page).

Notes on decisions and limits:
- I did not expand each Route::resource into its individual HTTP-method + path combinations (e.g., GET /posts, POST /posts, GET /posts/{post}, etc.) because those specific full paths and HTTP methods are not literally written in this file; they are produced by the Laravel resource naming convention. Instead I represented each resource declaration as a prefix entry and flagged is_derived_from_naming_convention = true, per your instruction to allow entries derived from framework-supported naming conventions.
- I included only routes whose paths can be determined from literal strings in this file or from the resource naming convention used by Laravel. I did not invent any other paths or handlers.

path.description: The HTTP request path, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}). Set this to null if it cannot be determined.
path.title: Path

handler.description: The function, class, class method, or object that handles the HTTP request. Use exactly "anonymous" to denote an anonymous implementation.
handler.title: Handler

handler_in_same_file.description: Whether the handler's implementation is present in the same source code file, rather than being imported.
handler_in_same_file.title: Handler In Same File

path_is_prefix.description: Whether the path string is a prefix rather than a full path.
path_is_prefix.title: Path Is Prefix

path_from_string_literal.description: Whether the path string is extracted from a literal string defined in the source code.
path_from_string_literal.title: Path From String Literal

path_from_naming_convention.description: Whether the path string is derived from a naming convention supported by the framework.
path_from_naming_convention.title: Path From Naming Convention

is_restful_api.description: Whether the API entry is for a RESTful API, rather than other types of APIs.
is_restful_api.title: Is Restful Api

is_testing_purposes.description: Whether the API entry is intended for testing purposes, such as unit tests or functional tests.
is_testing_purposes.title: Is Testing Purposes

entry.description: List of API entries you found.
entry.title: Entry
